greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of partial sums of alternating binomial coefficients: T(n,k) = Sum_{k=0..n} binomial(n,k)*(-1)^k.
comment: row sums give A000007; central terms give A110556;

Triangle T(n,k), 0 <= k <= n, read by rows, given by [1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, ...] DELTA [0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, ...] where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938. - _Philippe Deléham_, Sep 05 2005
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
Ângela Mestre, José Agapito, A Family of Riordan Group Automorphisms, J. Int. Seq., Vol. 22 (2019), Article 19.8.5.
Index entries for triangles and arrays related to Pascal's triangle
formula: T(n, k) = binomial(n-1, k)*(-1)^k, 0 <= k < n, T(n, n)=0^n.
program: (PARI) concat(1, for(n=1,10, for(k=0,n, print1(if(k != n, (-1)^k*binomial(n-1,k), 0), ", ")))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 31 2017
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 27 2005
